title: THE BRAZILIAN DIGITAL BATTLEFIELD: INVESTIGATING THE DYNAMICS OF POLITICAL INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS IN POST-BOLSONARO ERA | AoIR Selected Papers of Internet Research
snippet: This 2025 study by Giada Marino, Bruna Almeida Paroni, and Fabio Giglietto investigates misinformation campaigns on Facebook in Brazil from the 2022 elections to the aftermath of the attempted coup. It analyzes links shared in a coordinated fashion and reveals a bipartisan battlefield of political discourse.
description: This 2025 study investigates misinformation campaigns on Facebook in Brazil, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto. It analyzes coordinated sharing of links and reveals a bipartisan battlefield of political discourse.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - TEAM
snippet: This page mentions Fabio Giglietto as a professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo and provides a link to his personal website. It also mentions Giada Marino's involvement with the Computational Communication Science Lab.
description: The "Mapping Italian News Research Program - TEAM" page mentions Fabio Giglietto as a professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo and links to his personal website, also referencing related work at the Computational Communication Science Lab.

title: View of Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop Pipeline | Sociologica
snippet: This article, published in October 2024, discusses a validation protocol for LLM-integrated research, with Fabio Giglietto as one of the authors. It mentions Giglietto's research demonstrating that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks.
description: The article discusses integrating Large Language Models in political discourse studies on social media, and Fabio Giglietto is one of the authors. It mentions his research showing LLMs outperform fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: This article discusses a vera.ai project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto and others at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam. The project focused on the persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact-checking.
description: The article discusses a vera.ai project on misinformation resilience facilitated by Fabio Giglietto at the Digital Media Initiative Winter School at the University of Amsterdam.

title: informationdemocracy.org
description: An article from observatory.informationdemocracy.org lists scientists around the world who call to protect research on disinformation. Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as one of these scientists.

title: Coordinated Hateful Disinformation on Italian Politics and Social Issues, since 2017 | Request PDF - ResearchGate
snippet: This ResearchGate page mentions Fabio Giglietto's previous analysis of coordinated networks spreading harmful inflammatory false stories since 2017. It references his work (Giglietto et al., 2021) and his research on 'Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior' (CLSB) related to the 2018 and 2019 Italian elections and the coronavirus outbreak. It discusses his work in the context of coordinated disinformation campaigns on Facebook.
description: This ResearchGate page references Fabio Giglietto's research on coordinated disinformation campaigns related to Italian politics and the coronavirus outbreak, discussing his work on 'Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior' (CLSB) and his analysis of coordinated networks spreading false stories.

title: SOS! ORA L’ALGORITMO PUNTA SUI ‘COMPLOTTISTI’: “INTERVENIRE SUBITO!” - ByoBlu
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto presenting research at conferences in Brazil in October 2025, including using LLMs to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups, and moderating a roundtable on data access in the DSA era.
description: This article reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil in October 2025, discussing research on disinformation and digital manipulation, including the use of LLMs for analyzing political discourse and moderating a roundtable on data access.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
